{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3619021,"name":"dori m","username":"doggercow","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-10T13:52:41.618Z","cooked":"

hi
im from team 5635 and i want to research some different swerve modules.
my team used the mk4 and the mk4i from sds up until now and we are looking to upgrade soon.
the new mk5n looks promising but i was wondering if there were some other modules by other companies that you would recommend

Honestly the packaging and size and flexibility of the mk5 can’t be beat by far your best option

This, but if you’re looking for something to have before then, we ran the WCP x2st’s and they ran great

WestCoast Products

Swerve X2St

WCP's newest generation of the small swerve drive module, designed from the ground up to utilize the powerful Kraken X60 and X44 brushless motors to improve performance. This new design features a wider and larger diameter wheel, is more versatile...

Price: USD 324.99

We used WCP Xi this year and they worked great. Our new X2is came in a few weeks ago and we are looking forward to get them running. Generally, SDS modules are a bit larger than WCP. The SDS MK5n looks pretty solid, but also more complex. I’d look into both and determine which modules suit your team’s needs the best.

We were using mk4i and it has a good perform. But as far as i heard from other teams they slightly switcing to the WCP swerves. I would prefer X2T because of its speed.
